etymologies: Middle English (originally in the sense ‘seed, grain of corn’): from Old French grain, from Latin granum

definitions: wheat or any other cultivated cereal crop used as food.
shortDefinitions: cultivated cereal used as food

definitions: the seeds of cultivated cereals
shortDefinitions: seeds of such cereal

definitions: a single fruit or seed of a cereal
shortDefinitions: single fruit or seed of cereal

definitions: a small hard particle of a substance such as salt or sand
shortDefinitions: small hard particle of salt, sand, etc.

definitions: the smallest possible quantity or amount of a quality

examples.text: there wasn't a grain of truth in what he said

shortDefinitions: smallest possible quantity or amount of quality

definitions: a discrete particle or crystal in a metal, igneous rock, etc., typically visible only when a surface is magnified.
shortDefinitions: discrete particle or crystal in metal, igneous rock, etc.

definitions: a piece of solid propellant for use in a rocket engine.
shortDefinitions: piece of solid propellant used in rocket engine

definitions: the smallest unit of weight in the troy and avoirdupois systems, equal to 1/5760 of a pound troy and 1/7000 of a pound avoirdupois (approximately 0.0648 grams).
etymologies: because originally the weight was equivalent to that of a grain of corn
shortDefinitions: smallest unit of weight in troy and avoirdupois systems

definitions: the longitudinal arrangement or pattern of fibers in wood, paper, etc.

examples.text: he scored along the grain of the table with the knife

shortDefinitions: arrangement of fibres in wood, paper, etc.

definitions: roughness in texture of wood, stone, etc.; the arrangement and size of constituent particles

examples.text: the lighter, finer grain of the wood is attractive

shortDefinitions: roughness in texture of wood, stone, etc.

definitions: the rough or textured outer surface of leather, or of a similar artificial material.
shortDefinitions: rough or wrinkled outer surface of leather

definitions: lamination or planes of cleavage in materials such as stone and coal.
shortDefinitions: lamination or planes of cleavage in stone, coal, etc.

definitions: a granular appearance of a photograph or negative, which is in proportion to the size of the emulsion particles composing it.
shortDefinitions: grainy appearance of photograph

definitions: a person's character or natural tendency.
shortDefinitions: person's character or natural tendency

definitions: kermes or cochineal, or dye made from either of these.
shortDefinitions: kermes, cochineal, or dye made from these

definitions: give a rough surface or texture to

examples.text: her fingers were grained with chalk dust

shortDefinitions: give rough surface or texture to

definitions: form into grains

examples.text: if the sugar does grain up, add more water

shortDefinitions: form into grains

definitions: paint (something, especially furniture or interior surfaces) in imitation of the grain of wood or marble

examples.text: what is the use of having natural wood when you can grain it like that?

shortDefinitions: paint furniture to resemble grain of wood

definitions: remove hair from (a hide).
shortDefinitions: remove hair from hide

definitions: feed (a horse) on grain.
shortDefinitions: feed horse on grain
